resources.string: "It's how you deal with failure that determines how you achieve success." \n\n-David Feherty
"An investment in knowledge pays the best interest." \n\n-Benjamin Franklin
"I will tell you the secret to getting rich on Wall Street. You try to be greedy when others are fearful. And you try to be fearful when others are greedy." \n\n-Warren Buffett
"A nickel ain't worth a dime anymore." \n\n-Yogi Berra
"It’s not the employer who pays the wages. Employers only handle the money. It’s the customer who pays the wages." \n\n-Henry Ford

"You can only become truly accomplished at something you love. Don’t make money your goal. Instead, pursue the things you love doing, and then do them so well that people can’t take their eyes off you." \n\n-Maya Angelou
"How many millionaires do you know who have become wealthy by investing in savings accounts? I rest my case." \n\n-Robert G. Allen
"Let him who would enjoy a good future waste none of his present." \n\n-Roger Babson
"A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step." \n\n-Lao Tzu
"It takes as much energy to wish as it does to plan." \n\n-Eleanor Roosevelt
"If we command our wealth, we shall be rich and free. If our wealth commands us, we are poor indeed." \n\n-Edmund Burke
"A fool is wise in his eyes." \n\n-King Solomon
"Brass shines as fair to the ignorant as gold to the goldsmiths" \n\n-Elizabeth I
"There is little that can withstand a man who can conquer himself" \n\n-Louis XIV
"All money is a matter of belief" \n\n-Adam Smith
"A man in debt is so far a slave." \n\n-Ralph Waldo Emerson
"Be yourself, everyone else is already taken." \n\n-Oscar Wilde

"I think the internet is going to be one of the major forces for reducing the role of government. The one thing that’s missing but that will soon be developed, is a reliable e-cash." \n\n-Milton Friedman
"The future of money is digital currency." \n\n-Bill Gates
"It’s a hell of a lot harder for a few hundred thousand people to watch 7 1/2 billion. But what do you think happens when 7 1/2 billion of us stare back?" \n\n-Andreas M. Antonopoulos
"Everything will be tokenized and connected by a blockchain one day" \n\n-Fred Ehrsam
"Anything that can conceive of as a supply chain, blockchain can vastly improve its efficiency- it doesn’t matter if its people, numbers, data, money." \n\n–Ginni Rometty, CEO IBM
"You cannot un-invent this technology. You cannot turn this omelette back into eggs." \n\n-Andreas Antonopoulos

"Control of a currency is one of the most powerful tools a government wields; ask anybody in Ireland, Portugal, Greece, or Cyprus who lived through those countries’ recent financial crises." \n\n-Paul Vigna
"Bitcoin is a remarkable cryptographic achievement and the ability to create something that is not duplicable in the digital world has enormous value" \n\n-Eric Schmidt, Former CEO of Google
"40 years from now, blockchain and all that followed from it will figure more prominently in that story than will bitcoin." \n\n-Larry Summers, US Former Treasury Secretary
"I do think Bitcoin is the first that has the potential to do something like change the world." \n\n-Peter Thiel, Co-Founder of Paypal.
"Bitcoin is a technological tour de force." \n\n-Bill Gates
